channel.title: CVE Feed for Esri -- ArcGIS Enterprise Server
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Esri -- ArcGIS Enterprise Server

item.title: CVE-2023-25841|2024-10-08T16:31:23.414Z -- esri -- arcgis%20enterprise%20server
item.description:
There is a stored Cross-site Scripting vulnerability in Esri ArcGIS Server versions 10.8.1 – 11.0 on Windows and Linux platforms that may allow a remote, unauthenticated attacker to create crafted content which when clicked could potentially execute arbitrary JavaScript code in the victim’s browser.
Mitigation: Disable anonymous access to ArcGIS Feature services with edit capabilities.

item.title: CVE-2023-25848|2024-10-08T16:33:52.950Z -- esri -- arcgis%20enterprise%20server
item.description:
ArcGIS Enterprise Server versions 11.0 and below have an information disclosure vulnerability where a remote, unauthorized attacker may submit a crafted query that may result in a low severity information disclosure issue.
The information disclosed is limited to a single attribute in a database connection string. No business data is disclosed.

item.title: CVE-2023-25840|2024-10-08T16:31:09.302Z -- esri -- arcgis%20enterprise%20server
item.description: There is a Cross-site Scripting vulnerability in ArcGIS Server in versions 10.8.1 – 11.1 that may allow a remote, authenticated attacker to create a crafted link which onmouseover wont execute but could potentially render an image in the victims browser. The privileges required to execute this attack are high.
